332803550 6548851 854510 Unsigned Unsigned 06-22-93 06-27-93 ASSOCIATED DIAGNOSES : Steroid complications , including cataract , osteoporosis , diffuse fibrocystic breast disease , trigeminal neuralgia . She has no history of asbestos exposure or tuberculosis exposure . ALLERGIES : Notable for her diffuse expiratory wheezes and scattered expiratory crackles . Cranial nerves were intact except for paresthesias on the left in the VII and VIII distribution . LABORATORY DATA : Magnesium 1.7 . BUN 12 , creatinine 0.6 , glucose 92 , uric acid 3.3. Cholesterol 236 , triglycerides 115 , HDL 99 , LDL 114 , total protein 6.2 , globulin 2.6 , direct bilirubin 0 , total bilirubin 0.2 , alkaline phosphatase 59 , amylase 64 , SGOT 16 , LDH 141 , CPK 57 . The LH was 4.9 , FSH 3.3 . Urine cotenine level none detected . White blood count 9.6 , hematocrit 38.8 , platelet 348,000 , mean corpuscular volume 85 and 86 , MCH 29 , MCHC 34 . PT 9.5/10.0 , PTT 23.9 . Sed rate 6 . The patient was A+ . Cardiopulmonary exercise study results are pending . Echocardiogram showed normal right ventricular and left ventricular size and systolic function . A left and right heart catheterization and coronary angiogram revealed aortic 120/70 , mean 95 , PA 26/10 , mean 17 , PC 7 , RV 26/6 , RA 4 , cardiac output 5.7 , index 3.8 . Systemic arterial resistance 12/81 . A quantitative VQ scan of the lung showed 42% ventilation to the left , 57% ventilation to the right , 42% perfusion to the left , 57% perfusion to the right . Hepatitis serologies pending . She was noted to have mild cataracts , possibly due to chronic steroids , as well as a subtle temporal disc pallor OD , possibly due to previous episode of optic neuritis . This is left for further follow up as an outpatient . Dr. Tikkerth felt that the patient had mild adjustment related anxiety under good control with a history of tobacco abuse in the past . The patient completed the studies and to be informed of the results as an outpatient . She knows to return to her local physician for her routine care with her condition unchanged at the time of discharge . TR : bg / bmot 09-08-93 TD : 09/09/93
719127931 8/28/1998 12:00:00 AM Signed Admission Date : 08/28/1998 Discharge Date : 09/01/1998 PRINCIPAL DIAGNOSIS : COLON CANCER . HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS : The patient is a 54 year-old woman who noted an episode of rectal bleeding approximately three weeks prior to admission . This last for about 20 minutes . Since then , she has had no further episodes . The patient underwent an abdominal CAT scan which revealed two areas of metastatic disease in the liver . The patient currently feels well , denies any abdominal pain , nausea , vomiting , weight loss , denies any family history of colon cancer . SOCIAL HISTORY : The patient denies any smoking history and reports occasional alcohol consumption . MEDICATIONS ON ADMISSION : The patient had no known drug allergies . Blood pressure 120/60 , heart rate 76 , height 5 ' 5 " , weight 157 lbs . Skin was intact and tan . There was no palpable adenopathy . The neck was supple . The abdomen was soft , non-tender , non-distended . There were bowel sounds in all quadrants . Rectal examination revealed guaiac positive stool and no palpable masses . Neurological examination revealed that the patient was alert and oriented times three . Extremities revealed no evidence of edema of the lower extremities bilaterally . HOSPITAL COURSE : The patient tolerated the procedure well . The patient was transferred to the post anesthesia care unit in stable extubated state . From there , the patient was transferred to the surgical floor . Her nasogastric tube was removed on postoperative day number one and the patient was continued on our hospital colectomy pathway . She had had several bowel movements . She was tolerating a house diet and was tolerating her pain with the aid of Percocet to be taken orally . Her wound at the time of discharge was clean . The patient was discharged to her home in stable state . MEDICATIONS ON DISCHARGE : 2) Percocet 1-2 tablets p.o. q.4h. p.r.n. pain . FOLLOW-UP : Dictated By : LINEHY JESCGERLEBREUTZ , M.D. BW88 Attending : 03665 Index No. JIIRF6556Z 09/18/98
CTMC 936462 1/31/1990 12:00:00 AM DIS 01/31/1990 Report Status : 02/06/1990 DIAGNOSES : CORONARY ARTERY DISEASE . RULE OUT MYOCARDIAL INFARCTION . PERIPHERAL VASCULAR DISEASE . The patient is a 61 year old white male , who presented with a 2 to 3 week history of increasing exertional angina and rest angina . The patient has a 9 year history of diabetes mellitus , treated until 07-89 with oral hypoglycemic agents , then changed to insulin therapy secondary to poor control . The patient gave a history of 6 to 9 months of increasing fatigue , shortness of breath , general malaise , mild anorexia . There is no nausea , vomiting or diaphoresis . Of note , the patient had an exercise tolerance test on 9-7-89 , that was terminated at 6 minutes due to fatigue , where he reached a maximum heart rate of 131 , with a maximal blood pressure of 190/80 . There were no arrhythmias , no ST changes to suggest ischemia . FAMILY HISTORY is positive for a brother who died at age 62 of a cerebrovascular accident , a brother 60 years old with coronary artery disease , and a brother at 55 with coronary artery disease . His father had a history of diabetes and cerebrovascular accident , and mother died of a myocardial infarction . He had a regular rate and rhythm with a normal S1 , S2 , no murmurs , clicks , gallops or rubs . His extremities revealed no cyanosis , clubbing or edema . Pulses were II / II throughout , except for the posterior tibial and dorsalis pedis , which were 0/II . LABORATORY EXAMINATION : Hematocrit was 39.7 , white blood cell count 9.1 , platelets 202,000 , prothrombin time 12.4 , partial thromboplastin time 26.9 . There was mild flattening in V5 and V6 . Problem #1 was cardiac . He had multiple episodes during hospitalization of chest pain radiating to the back , during which his vital signs remained stable and there were no electrocardiogram changes . His pain resolved with nitroglycerin sublingually and occasional MSO4 intravenously . There was no chest pain , his peak heart rate was 150 , peak blood pressure 160/80 . Post-percutaneous transluminal coronary angioplasty the patient had recurrence of his chest pain and was returned for catheterization , which demonstrated patency of the obtuse marginal branch #2 . The patient was started on diltiazem and Isordil and remained pain-free on these medications . Problem #3 was fatigue . The leg pains were thought to be neuropathic in origin , thyroid function tests were within normal limits , ESR was 25 . DISPOSITION : The patient was discharged on 2-6-90 . MEDICATIONS ON DISCHARGE were Ecotrin 1 by mouth per day , NPH 50 units every morning , diltiazem 90 mg by mouth 4 times a day , Isordil 20 mg by mouth 3 times a day , nitroglycerin 1/150 1 sublingual as needed for chest pain . He was sent home on an 1,800 calorie American Diabetic Association diet , to have FOLLOW-UP by Dr. Thore . ________________________________ SR568/2592 RETA R.
